# How-to Guides

How-to guides are **task-oriented** recipes that guide you through steps to solve specific problems. They assume you already have some knowledge and need to accomplish something specific.

## Available Guides

### Diagram Authoring
- [Use Custom arch-explorer Extensions](./custom-extensions.md) - Add `%%{arch: ...}%%` directives
- [Define Edge Anchors](./edge-anchors.md) - Control where edges connect to nodes
- [Style Nodes and Edges](./styling.md) - Apply custom colors and styles

### Navigation Implementation
- [Implement Drill Navigation](./drill-navigation.md) - Replace view with subgraph contents
- [Implement Layer Navigation](./layer-navigation.md) - Overlay children above parent
- [Implement Fold Navigation](./fold-navigation.md) - Collapse/expand subgraphs in place

### Rendering
- [Create Custom Shapes](./custom-shapes.md) - Add new shape types
- [Generate Isometric Polygons](./isometric-shapes.md) - Build 3-face isometric shapes
- [Export Diagrams](./export.md) - Save as SVG or PNG

### Integration
- [Embed in Your Application](./embedding.md) - Use arch-explorer as a component
- [Parse External Mermaid Files](./external-files.md) - Load `.mmd` files

## How-to vs Tutorial

- **Tutorial**: "Let me teach you how arch-explorer works"
- **How-to**: "Here's how to accomplish X specific task"

How-to guides assume you understand the basics and need targeted help.
